fields_of_interest: Culture and media, Consumers, Culture, Education and training, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives: Alcohol advertising, Audiovisual Media Services Directive, Digital taxation, ePrivacy Regulation, Fake news, 'Follow the Money' initiative, Gender portrayal, General Data Protection Regulation, Online platforms, Unfair commercial practices
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication: Participation in EU structures and platforms
goals__remit: The European Association of Communications Agencies (EACA) represents more than 2500 communications agencies and agency associations from nearly 30 European countries that directly employ more than 120 000 people. EACA members include advertising, media, digital, branding and PR agencies. They create and place adverts and develop brand-building campaigns. EACA's main tasks are to promote: honest, effective advertising, high professional standards, awareness of the contribution of advertising in a free market economy, close co-operation between agencies, advertisers and media in European advertising bodies and an optimal external and internal operating environment for advertising agencies.
